definitions: scientific study of human behavior and mental processes including thoughts and emotions
mental characteristics or attitudes that influence behavior in specific situations
examples: She decided to major in psychology to understand human behavior better
Psychology researchers discovered new insights about memory formation recently
Understanding the psychology of consumers helps companies create effective marketing strategies
The team's winning psychology made them unstoppable during the playoffs

definitions: systematic principles and methods of reasoning used to analyze arguments and draw conclusions
sensible or reasonable quality of thought or action in practical situations
examples: Students learn formal logic to construct valid arguments in philosophy class
The computer program uses Boolean logic to process data efficiently
There's no logic in driving during rush hour when you can walk
Her decision followed a simple logic that everyone could understand

definitions: social science that studies production distribution and consumption of goods and services
practical considerations of cost and resource management in various contexts
examples: He studied economics to understand global financial markets and trade policies
Economics professors often debate the effects of government spending on inflation
The economics of running a small business require careful budget planning
We need to consider the economics before launching this expensive project

definitions: recent information or news about a particular situation or development
modified or improved version of software hardware or other systems
examples: The manager gave us an update on the project's progress this morning
We're waiting for an update from the hospital about her condition
The software update fixed several bugs and improved system performance significantly
Make sure to install the security update on your computer tonight

definitions: supernatural evil being often depicted as the enemy of God and humanity
person who is very difficult mischievous or causes trouble for others
examples: Many religions teach about the devil as a tempter of humanity
The painting depicted the devil with horns and a pitchfork
That little devil ate all the cookies before dinner again
He can be a real devil when he doesn't get his way

definitions: regular rhythm or pulse in music measured by stressed and unstressed sounds
regular path or area covered by someone on duty especially police officers
examples: The drummer kept a steady beat throughout the entire jazz performance
Dancing to the beat of the music filled the club with energy
Officer Johnson walked his beat through downtown for twenty years straight
The reporter covered the political beat for the local newspaper diligently

definitions: organization that provides help and raises money for those in need
voluntary giving of help or money to those in need without expecting return
examples: The charity raised millions of dollars for disaster relief efforts worldwide
She volunteers at a local charity that feeds homeless families weekly
Her acts of charity toward struggling neighbors showed true compassion and kindness
The billionaire was known for his charity to educational institutions globally

definitions: thin thread of natural or synthetic material used in making cloth or rope
indigestible plant material that aids digestion and promotes healthy bowel movements
examples: Cotton fiber is harvested from plants to make comfortable clothing fabric
The rope was made from strong synthetic fiber that wouldn't break easily
Eating enough fiber helps prevent constipation and maintains digestive health naturally
Whole grains and vegetables are excellent sources of dietary fiber daily

definitions: close personal relationship between people based on mutual affection trust and support
state of being friends or the friendly feeling between nations or groups
examples: Their friendship lasted through decades of life changes and challenges together
True friendship means being there for someone during difficult times unconditionally
The treaty promoted friendship between the two countries after years of conflict
Building friendship among team members improved workplace productivity and morale significantly

definitions: material made of string wire or thread woven together with spaces between
amount remaining after all deductions such as taxes or expenses are subtracted
examples: The fishing net caught dozens of salmon during the morning expedition
She hung a mosquito net over her bed for protection at night
His net income after taxes was lower than he had expected initially
The company's net profit increased by twenty percent this quarter impressively

definitions: internal or external factors that stimulate desire and energy to achieve goals
process of encouraging or inspiring someone to take action or improve performance
examples: Her motivation to succeed came from wanting to help her family financially
Lack of motivation can make even simple tasks feel impossibly difficult sometimes
The coach's motivation techniques helped athletes perform beyond their usual limits
Employee motivation programs increased productivity and job satisfaction throughout the company

definitions: supply of something kept for use when needed in the future
area of land set aside for protection of wildlife or natural resources
examples: The country maintains oil reserves for emergency situations and supply disruptions
She always keeps a reserve of cash for unexpected expenses at home
The nature reserve protects endangered species from hunting and habitat destruction
Visitors can observe wildlife in their natural habitat at the reserve

definitions: person who watches or notices something happening without actively participating
official representative sent to monitor and report on events or proceedings
examples: A careful observer would notice the subtle changes in her behavior lately
The accident had several observers who provided witness statements to police officers
The UN sent observers to monitor the election process for fairness internationally
Military observers reported on ceasefire violations along the contested border region daily

definitions: all human beings collectively considered as a whole group or species
quality of being humane showing compassion kindness and benevolence toward others
examples: Climate change poses a serious threat to the future of humanity worldwide
Throughout history humanity has shown remarkable ability to adapt and survive
The doctor's humanity shone through in her gentle treatment of patients daily
We must not lose our humanity even during the most difficult times

definitions: person who continues to live after a dangerous event accident or illness
person who copes well with difficulties and manages despite challenging circumstances
examples: The earthquake survivor was rescued after three days trapped under rubble
Cancer survivors often become advocates for research and early detection programs
She's a survivor who built a successful life after childhood poverty
Despite multiple business failures he remained a survivor in the industry

definitions: structure made of wood metal or wire that surrounds or divides an area
person who buys and sells stolen goods as an illegal business activity
examples: We built a wooden fence around the garden to keep deer out
The white picket fence gave the house a charming traditional appearance perfectly
The police arrested the fence who was selling stolen electronics downtown regularly
Thieves often work with a fence to convert stolen items into cash

definitions: quality of being funny or the ability to appreciate and express amusement
fluid in the body especially those once believed to determine temperament and health
examples: His sense of humor helped everyone relax during stressful meetings at work
The comedian's humor appealed to audiences of all ages and backgrounds equally
Medieval doctors believed balancing the body's humors would cure most illnesses
The vitreous humor fills the space between the lens and retina

definitions: military officer rank above captain and below lieutenant colonel in most armies
main subject of study chosen by a college or university student
examples: Major Thompson led the battalion through difficult terrain during training exercises yesterday
She was promoted to major after fifteen years of distinguished military service
His major in computer science prepared him well for the tech industry
Many students change their major at least once during college years typically

definitions: ceremony held after someone's death usually before burial or cremation takes place
observances and rituals associated with honoring and remembering someone who has died
examples: The funeral service was held at the church where she had worshipped
Hundreds of people attended the funeral to pay their final respects together
Traditional funeral customs vary greatly between different cultures and religious beliefs worldwide
The funeral procession moved slowly through the streets to the cemetery

definitions: person who speaks officially for a group organization or government entity
person chosen to speak publicly on behalf of others in various situations
examples: The company spokesman announced the merger at today's press conference downtown
A government spokesman declined to comment on the ongoing investigation yesterday evening
The union spokesman presented workers' demands during contract negotiations this morning
Each team selected a spokesman to present their project to the board

definitions: part added to something to make it longer larger or more comprehensive
additional time allowed for completing a task or meeting a requirement
examples: The home extension added two bedrooms and a larger kitchen space beautifully
Hair extensions gave her the long flowing look she always wanted
The professor granted a three-day extension on the research paper deadline
Tax filing extensions give people extra time to prepare their returns properly

definitions: person who studies and writes about past events and historical periods professionally
person who researches documents and preserves records of past events systematically
examples: The historian discovered new documents that changed understanding of the Civil War
Medieval historians rely heavily on church records and archaeological findings for research
Local historians work to preserve the stories of small communities nationwide diligently
The company historian maintains archives of important corporate milestones and decisions

definitions: substance produced by or used in chemistry with distinct molecular composition
manufactured substance used in industrial processes or commercial products
examples: Water is a chemical compound made of hydrogen and oxygen atoms bonded
The laboratory stored dangerous chemicals in specially ventilated cabinets for safety
The factory produces chemicals used in making plastics and synthetic materials
Agricultural chemicals help farmers increase crop yields but require careful handling

definitions: person who performs songs professionally using their voice as the instrument
anyone who sings whether professionally or as an amateur activity
examples: The opera singer practiced scales for hours to maintain vocal flexibility daily
Famous singers often struggle with maintaining privacy in their personal lives
Every singer in the choir contributed to the beautiful harmonies last night
She's a shower singer who dreams of performing on stage someday

definitions: round vegetable with many layers and strong smell used in cooking worldwide
plant of the lily family grown for its edible bulb with pungent flavor
examples: Chopping onions always makes my eyes water no matter what trick I try
The recipe calls for two medium onions diced and sautéed until golden
Spring onions add a mild flavor to salads and stir-fry dishes perfectly
The farmer harvested onions after their tops had dried and fallen over

definitions: person who concentrates on a particular area of activity or knowledge professionally
doctor who has advanced training in a specific area of medicine
examples: The company hired a cybersecurity specialist to protect their digital assets effectively
As a specialist in medieval literature she published several influential scholarly articles
My doctor referred me to a heart specialist for further testing immediately
The specialist recommended surgery after reviewing all the test results carefully

definitions: lightest color that reflects all visible wavelengths of light equally
racial classification historically used for people of European ancestry
examples: The bride wore a traditional white wedding dress with pearl buttons everywhere
Fresh white snow covered the mountain peaks creating a stunning winter landscape
Census forms often include white as a racial category option for respondents
The neighborhood's demographics shifted from predominantly white to more diverse recently

definitions: flat metal container with handle used for cooking food on stovetops
horizontal movement of a camera to follow action or survey a scene
examples: She heated olive oil in the pan before adding chopped vegetables carefully
The non-stick pan makes cooking eggs much easier without adding butter
The director used a slow pan to reveal the vast desert landscape
Camera operators must pan smoothly to avoid jarring the audience uncomfortably

definitions: flat surface forming the floor of a ship or outdoor platform area
complete set of playing cards typically containing fifty-two cards plus jokers
examples: Passengers enjoyed the sunset from the upper deck during the cruise
We built a wooden deck behind our house for summer barbecues
She shuffled the deck thoroughly before dealing cards to each player
The magician asked someone to pick any card from the deck randomly

definitions: image seen in a mirror water or other reflective surface showing reversed appearance
serious thought or consideration about something important or meaningful
examples: Her reflection in the lake showed clearly in the still morning water
The mirror's reflection revealed a small stain on his shirt collar
After much reflection she decided to change careers and pursue teaching
The essay required deep reflection on personal values and life goals

definitions: structured collection of data stored and accessed electronically by computer systems
organized system for storing retrieving and managing information efficiently
examples: The company's database contains millions of customer records and transaction histories
Database administrators ensure data security and system performance around the clock daily
Libraries use databases to catalog books and help patrons find resources quickly
The research database includes thousands of peer-reviewed scientific articles and studies

definitions: official authorization or consent to do something that would otherwise be forbidden
act of allowing someone to do something or go somewhere
examples: Students need written permission from parents to go on field trips
The city granted permission to build a new shopping center downtown
She asked permission to leave work early for a doctor's appointment
Website cookies require user permission before tracking browsing data nowadays

definitions: particular way of living that reflects a person's values and attitudes
pattern of consumption and behavior associated with particular social groups
examples: Her healthy lifestyle includes daily exercise and eating organic foods exclusively
Moving to the countryside completely changed their lifestyle for the better
Marketing targets specific lifestyle groups with tailored advertising messages and products
The magazine focuses on luxury lifestyle trends among wealthy urban professionals

definitions: large carnivorous cat native to Africa and Asia with tawny coat and mane
person who shows great courage or receives much attention and admiration
examples: The lion stalked through tall grass hunting zebras on the African savanna
Male lions grow impressive manes that signal maturity and genetic fitness
She was a lion in battle defending her country with fierce determination
The literary lion received numerous awards throughout his distinguished writing career

definitions: process of using up resources goods or services for various purposes
act of eating or drinking something especially in relation to health
examples: Energy consumption increases dramatically during hot summer months with air conditioning use
The report analyzed consumption patterns of different demographic groups across regions
Excessive consumption of sugary drinks contributes to obesity and diabetes rates
Alcohol consumption guidelines recommend limiting intake to moderate levels for health

definitions: power or ability to do something effectively based on skill or resources
features or functions that a system machine or organization can perform
examples: The new manager demonstrated strong leadership capability from her first day
We need to assess our manufacturing capability before accepting large orders
The software's capability includes advanced data analysis and visualization tools efficiently
Military capability depends on training equipment and strategic planning working together effectively

definitions: production and discharge of gas radiation or other substances into the environment
release of energy in the form of waves or particles from a source
examples: Carbon emissions from vehicles contribute significantly to air pollution and climate change
The factory installed filters to reduce harmful emissions into the atmosphere
Radio emission from distant galaxies helps astronomers study the universe's evolution
The emission of light from fireflies involves a complex chemical reaction process

definitions: narrow column alongside main content on a webpage or printed page
private discussion between judge and lawyers away from the jury
examples: The website's sidebar contains links to related articles and advertisements
Important information appeared in a sidebar next to the main article text
The judge called a sidebar to discuss the admissibility of evidence privately
During the sidebar attorneys argued about allowing certain testimony in court

definitions: things that are of extremely poor quality or completely worthless
stupid or untrue talk that wastes time or misleads people
examples: Clean out all that crap from the garage before we move houses
The store was selling cheap crap that broke after one use
Don't believe that crap about getting rich quickly through this scheme
He talks so much crap that nobody takes him seriously anymore

definitions: person or business that buys and sells particular goods commercially
person who distributes playing cards in a card game
examples: The car dealer offered competitive prices on all new vehicle models available
Art dealers travel worldwide searching for valuable pieces to sell later
The dealer shuffled cards expertly before starting the poker game tonight
In blackjack the dealer must follow strict rules about drawing cards

definitions: exact size weight or amount of something determined using standard units
action or process of measuring something to determine its dimensions or quantity
examples: The tailor took precise measurements before cutting the expensive fabric carefully
Temperature measurements showed a gradual warming trend over several decades globally
Accurate measurement requires proper tools and careful attention to detail always
The measurement of success varies greatly depending on personal values and goals

definitions: person who provides recommendations and guidance in a particular area
professional who offers expert advice to individuals or organizations
examples: The academic adviser helped her choose courses for her major requirements wisely
Financial advisers recommend diversifying investments to reduce risk exposure significantly
The president relies on military advisers for national security decisions daily
Career advisers at the university assist students with job search strategies

definitions: faculty of forming new ideas or images not present to the senses
ability to think of new ideas or create mental pictures creatively
examples: Children's imagination turns cardboard boxes into spaceships and castles effortlessly
Writers need strong imagination to create believable fictional worlds and characters
Use your imagination to solve this problem in an unconventional way
The artist's imagination produced stunning surreal paintings that challenged reality completely

definitions: extremely sad event often involving death loss or great suffering
serious play or story with an unhappy ending especially involving a hero's downfall
examples: The earthquake was a tragedy that claimed thousands of innocent lives sadly
Personal tragedy struck when both parents died in the car accident
Shakespeare's tragedy Hamlet explores themes of revenge and moral corruption deeply
Greek tragedies often depicted heroes destroyed by their own fatal flaws

definitions: professional who provides expert advice to organizations for a fee
specialist brought in to analyze problems and recommend solutions
examples: The management consultant identified inefficiencies in the company's operations quickly
Healthcare consultants help hospitals improve patient care and reduce costs effectively
She works as an independent consultant for several technology startups simultaneously
The consultant's report recommended major changes to the marketing strategy immediately

definitions: commissioned officer in armed forces ranking below captain in most services
deputy or assistant to someone in a position of authority
examples: Lieutenant Martinez led her platoon through combat training exercises this morning
He was promoted from second lieutenant to first lieutenant last month
The gang leader's lieutenant handled drug distribution in the eastern territory
She served as the CEO's lieutenant managing daily operations efficiently

definitions: unit of land area equal to 43560 square feet commonly used in property measurement
measure of land typically used for farms real estate and large properties
examples: The farm covers two hundred acres of fertile soil perfect for crops
Each acre of rainforest contains incredible biodiversity worth preserving forever
They bought five acres to build their dream home with gardens
The wildfire burned through thousands of acres before firefighters contained it

definitions: picture or diagram made with pencil pen or other implements on paper
process of choosing winners randomly in a lottery or competition
examples: Her pencil drawing captured every detail of the old building perfectly
Children express creativity through drawing before they can write words fluently
The lottery drawing takes place every Wednesday and Saturday at eight
Names were selected by random drawing from all eligible participants equally

definitions: action or event causing public outrage or damaging someone's reputation significantly
situation involving allegations of wrongdoing that attracts widespread negative attention
examples: The corruption scandal forced several government officials to resign immediately yesterday
Celebrity scandals often dominate tabloid headlines for weeks attracting massive readership
The accounting scandal revealed years of fraudulent financial reporting by executives
Political scandals can destroy careers and change election outcomes dramatically overnight

definitions: highest ranking diplomat who represents their country in another nation officially
person who acts as a representative or promoter of specified activity
examples: The ambassador presented her credentials to the foreign minister yesterday morning
Ambassadors work to maintain peaceful relations between their home and host countries
She became a brand ambassador for the luxury fashion company last year
UNICEF ambassadors travel globally promoting children's rights and welfare programs everywhere
